definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Next day he comes by again, and she brags that she didn't dream of him.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，他又来了，她嘲笑根本没有梦到他。

sentences.english: Son of man KongZhu dream Dan by other seduce, woke up very worried.
sentences.chinese: 孙子梦到丹孔珠被别的男人勾引，醒来之后非常担忧。

sentences.english: Last night, I dream, you dreamed of a long run, how to catch up with recovery.
sentences.chinese: 我昨晚做梦，梦到你跑的好远，怎么追也追不上。

sentences.english: In the night I dreamt about my dreams.
sentences.chinese: 那个晚上，我就可以梦到自己的梦想。

sentences.english: Dreams of us together, then I was spineless laugh awake.
sentences.chinese: 梦到我们在一起了，然后我就很没有骨气的笑醒了。

sentences.english: The sailor often dreamed about home.
What type of dreams do we repeatedly have night after night?
sentences.chinese: 什么样的内容使我们夜复一夜反复梦到的呢？

sentences.english: I still dream of that tart.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然经常梦到那种馅饼。

sentences.english: Or your teeth crumble into powder.
sentences.chinese: 或者梦到牙齿碎成粉状。

sentences.english: Usually, that host represents the dream.
sentences.chinese: 通常，梦到主持人代表着梦者的才华。

sentences.english: So what dreams did participants revisit the most often?
sentences.chinese: 什么梦是这些受访者们最常反复梦到的呢？

sentences.english: Precognitive Dreaming is the ability to see the future through dreams.
sentences.chinese: 梦到未来是通过梦境预言未来的一种能力。

sentences.english: Last night I had a bizarre dream. I went scuba diving with Aaron in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我做了个怪梦，梦到我和艾伦在海里玩水肺潜水。

sentences.english: Western people are dreaming now of tigers and dragons.
sentences.chinese: 西方人梦到了龙腾虎跃。

sentences.english: Dreams of paralysis can also fit into this category.
sentences.chinese: 梦到肢体瘫痪也可以归到这一类来。

sentences.english: I dreamed about this one-legged seaman for many nights afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 那以后我经常梦到他说的那个一条腿的水手。

definition: to dream about (sth or sb)/to see in a dream
to dream/to have a dream/fig. illusion/fantasy/pipe dream
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to share the bed/(fig.) to be married
to wake up from a sleep
talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
